Title: 69006 - EM - Polling Place Search - Search fields and bugs

Step Action:
Pre-requisite:
- Have an existing Polling Place
Navigate to Election Management > Polling Places > Search Polling Place
Step Expected: Maintain Polling Place page is displayed

Step Action: Check top of page
Step Expected: The title of the page should be "Maintain Polling Place"

Step Action: Check the search criteria
Step Expected:
The following fields are displayed:
- Polling Place Name
- Polling Place Street Name
- Precincts
- District
- Voter Center ID

Step Action: In the Polling Place Name field, enter the first few characters of the existing Polling Place Name followed by "%" (e.g. TH%)
Step Expected: Data entered

Step Action: Click "Search"
Step Expected: Only the Polling Places beginning with those first few characters entered will displayed and your existing Polling Place will also be shown

Step Action: Click "Reset"
Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Step Action: In the Polling Place Name field, enter "%" followed by the last few characters of the existing Polling Place Name (e.g. TE%)
Step Expected: Data entered

Step Action: Click "Search"
Step Expected: Only the Polling Places ending with those last few characters entered will displayed and your existing Polling Place will also be shown

Step Action: Click "Reset"
Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Step Action: In the Polling Place Name search field, enter "%" and then any few characters of the existing Election Template name followed by another "%" (e.g. %EC%)
Step Expected: Data entered

Step Action: Click "Search"
Step Expected: Only the Polling Places with those few characters entered (in that order) will be displayed and your existing Polling Place will also be shown

Step Action: Click "Reset"
Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Step Action: In the Polling Place Name search field, enter the first few characters of the existing Polling Place Name followed by "%" and then any few characters that the name contains, followed by another "%" (e.g. T%PL%)
Step Expected: Data entered

Step Action: Click "Search"
Step Expected: Only the Polling Places that begin with those characters and contain those characters entered will be displayed and your existing Polling Place will also be shown

Step Action: Click "Reset"
Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Step Action: In the Polling Place Name search field, enter "%" and then any few characters of the existing Polling Place Name followed by another "%" and then the last few characters of the Polling Place Name (e.g. %CT%E)
Step Expected: Date entered

Step Action: Click "Search"
Step Expected: Only the Polling Places that finish with those characters and contain those characters entered will be displayed and your existing Polling Place will also be shown

Step Action: Click "Reset"
Step Expected: The search criteria is cleared

Step Action: Repeat steps 5-19 this time for Polling Place Street Name and Voter Center ID fields
Step Expected: Polling Place Street Name and Voter Center ID search fields work as expected the same as Polling Place Name

Step Action: From the District search criteria dropdown select the District linked to the existing Polling Place and click "Search"
Step Expected: All Polling places under that District will be displayed and your existing Polling Place will also be shown

Step Action: Navigate from Home > Polling Places > Search Polling Place and check for the presence of the "Health Care Facility" checkbox.
Step Expected: The "Health Care Facility" checkbox is visible and functional.

Step Action:
Navigate from Home > Polling Places > Search Polling Place and 2. Verify the presence of:
- Early Voting Location
- Voter Center
- Drop Box Location
Step Expected: All existing checkboxes are visible and functional.

Step Action: Navigate from Home > Polling Places > Search Polling Place and Select multiple checkboxes and Deselect one checkbox (e.g., "Health Care Facility").
Step Expected: The deselected checkbox becomes unchecked.

Step Action: Navigate from Home > Polling Places > Search Polling Place and Select multiple checkbox options and Save the polling location details and Navigate away and return to the polling location type selection.
Step Expected: The previously selected checkboxes remain checked.

Title: 69007 - EM - Polling Place Search - Update Polling Place Search Screen with ADD Button Functionality

Step Action:
Pre-requisite:
- Have an existing Polling Place
Navigate to Election Management > Polling Places > Search Polling Place
Step Expected: Maintain Polling Place page is displayed

Step Action: Use any of the search criteria options to search for the existing Polling Place
Step Expected: The "SEARCH" button works as expected and initiates the search, the existing Polling Place will be listed

Step Action: Click "RESET"
Step Expected: The search criteria will be cleared

Step Action: In the Polling Place Name search field enter a name that doesn't already exist and click "SEARCH"
Step Expected: No results will be displayed

Step Action: Click "ADD"
Step Expected: The Add Polling Place page will be displayed and the Polling Place Name will be pre-filled with what you searched for

Step Action: Click "Cancel"
Step Expected: The Maintaining Polling Place page will be displayed

Step Action: Repeat steps 5 to 7 for Polling Place Street Name and Voter Center ID search fields
Step Expected: All search fields are pre-populated over to the Add Polling Place page correctly when searched for and then clicking "ADD"

Step Action: Repeat steps 5 to 7 for Precincts and Districts search dropdowns
Step Expected: Precincts and Districts should not pre-populate over to the Add Polling Place page when searching and then clicking "ADD"

Step Action: Navigate to Polling places->Search Polling Place->Select a record from the search results->Click on View
Step Expected: Additional contacts tab must be added

Step Action:
Verify below fields are displayed correctly
first name
last name
position
work phone
mobile phone
email
address
Add(Button)
Actions
Step Expected: All the page elements must be displayed

Step Action: Click on Actions->edit
Step Expected: The Text fields on the Update Contact page should be editable.

Step Action: Make changes and click on save button
Step Expected:
1.Updates must be saved successfully
2.User must return to Polling place page

Step Action: Make changes and click on cancel button
Step Expected:
1.Updates should not be saved 
2.User must return to Polling place page

Step Action: Click on "ADD" on Additional Contacts Page
Step Expected: Fill all the mandatory fields and click "ADD"

Step Action: Verify the new contact  is added to the polling place ->Additional contacts tab
Step Expected:
1.New additional contact must be added successfully 
2.Verify the data displayed on Additional contacts grid matches the data entered in Add Contact Page

Step Action: select a record from rid and the Click on Actions->Delete
Step Expected: Additional contact must be deleted successfully

Step Action: Verify the primary contact information is  displayed on the polling place page
Step Expected: Data must be displayed appropriately only primary contact information must be displayed on polling place page

Step Action: Verify additional contacts  are not displayed on the polling place page
Step Expected: Additional contacts  must be displayed in the tab section

Title: EM - PollingPlace - Add/Maintain Polling Place Inventory

Step Action:
The following steps will be used in order to exercise and test 'Add/Maintain Inventory' functionality within a 'Polling Place'.
Tester will need to be logged in as a region. Click 'System Management' > 'Login As Region" > Select a region from the dropdown and click 'Login As Region' button.

Navigate to the 'Polling Place' screen
EM > Polling Places >Search Polling Places > Click 'Actions' > Click 'View'
Step Expected:
Land on the 'Polling Places' screen
'Inventory' tab appears in the grid

Step Action: Click the 'Inventory' tab
Step Expected:
Inventory tab is displayed
'Add' button is displayed
'Actions', 'Inventory Item', 'Description', and 'Count' are displayed as grid columns
Any previously added polling place inventory items are displayed

Step Action: Click 'Add'
Step Expected:
Land on 'Add Inventory' Screen
'Inventory Item', 'Status' dropdowns are displayed.
'Vendor/ Manufacturer', 'Make', 'Count', 'Model', 'Serial Number', 'Certification Attachment', 'Description' fields are displayed.
'Date of Certification' field and Calendar Icon are displayed, 
 'Add/Maintain Items', 'Save', 'Cancel' buttons are displayed .
Any Previously created inventory items are displayed in the 'Inventory Item' dropdown

Step Action: Click 'Add/Maintain Items'
Step Expected:
Land on 'Inventory Items' screen.
'Actions', 'Inventory Item', and 'Description' columns appear in the grid.
'Add' and 'Back' buttons appear.
Any previously created inventory items for this polling place populate the grid.

Step Action: Click 'Add'
Step Expected:
Land on 'Inventory Item' Screen
'Inventory Item' and 'Description' fields displayed
'Save' and 'Cancel' buttons displayed

Step Action: Enter an inventory item, and a description of the item and click 'Save'
Step Expected:
Land back on the 'Inventory Items' screen.
Success notification is displayed
The Item you created is displayed in the Grid appropriately.

Step Action: Click 'Actions' then click 'Edit' for a given item
Step Expected: Land on 'Update Inventory Item'

Step Action: Update the item and description fields then click 'Update'
Step Expected:
Land back on the 'Inventory Items' screen.
Success notification is displayed.
The item has been updated and displays properly in the grid.

Step Action: Click 'Back'
Step Expected: Land on 'Inventory' screen

Step Action:
Click the 'Inventory Item' dropdown and choose the previously updated item
Enter a count number, and add a comment.
Click 'Save'
Step Expected:
Land in the 'Inventory' tab of the 'Polling Place' screen
Receive a success message
The inventory item populates the grid

Step Action: Click 'Actions' then click 'Edit' for the inventory item
Step Expected: Land on the 'Update Inventory Screen'

Step Action: Click 'Cancel'
Step Expected: Land back on the inventory tab of the polling place

Step Action: Click 'Actions' then click 'Delete' for the inventory item
Step Expected: Confirmation popup/modal appears

Step Action: Click 'OK'
Step Expected:
Modal closes
Success message is displayed
The inventory item has been removed and is no longer displayed in the grid

Title: 69032-EM-PollingPlace-Validate Precinct can not be assigned to Multiple Polling Places

Step Action: Navigate to EM-PollingPlace-Search Polling Place
Step Expected: Search Polling Place screen must be displayed

Step Action: Click Actions-View-Precinct Assignment-Add/Maintain
Step Expected: Assign Polling Place Precincts screen must be displayed

Step Action: Select a Precinct that is currently assigned to another Polling Place
Step Expected:
System must display below error message
"Precinct already assigned to another Polling Place"

Step Action:
Precondition:1.Polling Places must be assigned to a precinct
2.Polling places that have any of the following checkboxes selected—Early Voting, Vote Center, Drop Box, or Healthcare Facility on —will be displayed on this page
Navigate to EM-Elections-Search-Actions-Manage Polling location/Precinct
Step Expected: Polling Place and Precinct Assignment Screen must be displayed

Step Action: Polling places and precincts must be displayed under respective categories
Step Expected:
Early Voting 
Vote Center
Drop Box
Healthcare Facility

Step Action: When a user navigates to the page system must only display the precincts/polling places which are unassigned
Step Expected: System should not display already assigned polling places /precincts

Step Action: Verify each nod/category is displaying the correct polling locations
Step Expected: Each category or node, such as Early Voting, should only display polling locations that have the early voting checkbox selected at the time of creating or updating the  polling booth

Step Action: Verify the precinct assigned to  polling booth
Step Expected: Precinct assigned on the Police place search  page must be displayed appropriately

Polling PlaceAddress
Precincts 
Early Voting
Voter Center
Drop Box location 
Healthcare Facility

Step Expected: Paging must function correctly

Title: EM - 76754 - Verify the Ability to Add Standard Business Hours for a New Polling Place

Step Action: Preconditions - User is logged in with appropriate credentials (Region, Elections role). User navigates to the "Polling Places" page.
Click on "Add" to create a new polling place.
In the "Standard Business Hours" field, enter “9:00 AM - 5:00 PM”.
Click "Save" to save the record.
Step Expected: The polling place must be successfully added with the "Standard Business Hours" field populated with the entered value.

Title: EM -  76754 - Verify the Ability to Edit Standard Business Hours for an Existing Polling Place

Step Action: Given user is logged in with appropriate credentials (Region, Elections role). At least one polling place record exists.
Search for an existing polling place record.
Click on the "Edit" button for the polling place.
In the "Standard Business Hours" field, modify the text to any other value.
Click "Save" to save the updated record.
Step Expected: The polling place is successfully updated with the new "Standard Business Hours" value.

Title: EM - 76754 - Verify the Standard Business Hours Field is Optional

Step Action: Given User is logged in with appropriate credentials (Region, Elections role). User navigates to the "Polling Places" page.
Click on "Add" to create a new polling place.
Leave the "Standard Business Hours" field blank.
Click "Save" to save the record.
Step Expected: The polling place is saved successfully without any value in the "Standard Business Hours" field.

Title: EM - 76754 - Verify No Validation for the Free-Form Field

Step Action: Given User is logged in with appropriate credentials (Region, Elections role). User navigates to the "Polling Places" page.
Click on "Add" to create a new polling place.
In the "Standard Business Hours" field, enter an invalid value (e.g., "12345 ABC" or "invalid hours").
Click "Save" to save the record.
Step Expected: The polling place is saved successfully with the entered value in the "Standard Business Hours" field, as no validation is required.

Step Action: Navigate to EM->Polling Places->Search Polling Place->ADD
Step Expected: Land on 'Add Polling Place' screen

Step Action: Enter 'Polling Place Name 'along with  the mandatory  address fields and click on Submit(Must enter a valid address)
Step Expected:
1.Entered address location must be pointed on the GIS Map
2.Coordinates must be returned and displayed on the Map
